hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Convergence Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: When two or more catalysts (options expiry + BOJ decision + negative news) occur within 24 hours, the subsequent price move will be amplified by 2.3-2.8x the average 10-day move for similar volatility regimes, with direction determined by the highest-impact catalyst.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Multiple catalysts in short timeframe create information overload, causing delayed or exaggerated reactions as different market participants process information at different speeds. Convergence increases probability of sustained directional move.
entry_conditions: Two or more catalysts occur within 24-hour window (options expiry Dec 26, BOJ decision, negative news)
Clear directional bias emerges within 4 hours of final catalyst (price breaks key level with volume confirmation)
Social media sentiment divergence >25% between retail and institutional sources (amplification signal)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.5x the average 10-day ATR for current volatility regime
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.2x the average 10-day ATR in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price remains range-bound (<0.8x ATR move) for 24 hours post-catalysts despite high catalyst density
